Sentencas: An energetic and economic analysis of a decentralized natural gas-fuelled solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) power plant in the range of 200 kW capacity is carried out.
Titulo: Optimization of a 200 kW SOFC cogeneration power plant. Part II: variation of the flowsheet

Sentencas: All calculations start from a basic plant concept with a simple flowsheet and a basic parameter set of SOFC operation and economic data.
Titulo: Optimization of a 200 kW SOFC cogeneration power plant. Part II: variation of the flowsheet

Sentencas: Changes in costs of electricity and plant efficiencies are determined for variations of the plant concept.
Titulo: Optimization of a 200 kW SOFC cogeneration power plant. Part II: variation of the flowsheet

Sentencas: Flowsheets with gas recycling by blowers or jet boosters are described.
Titulo: Optimization of a 200 kW SOFC cogeneration power plant. Part II: variation of the flowsheet

Sentencas: Cathode gas recycling by jet boosters turns out to be more advantageous with respect to the costs of electricity than gas recycling by hot gas fans.
Titulo: Optimization of a 200 kW SOFC cogeneration power plant. Part II: variation of the flowsheet

Sentencas: The influence of pressure drop in the cathode gas circuit is analyzed.
Titulo: Optimization of a 200 kW SOFC cogeneration power plant. Part II: variation of the flowsheet

Sentencas: In case of anode gas recycling an internal steam circuit exists.
Titulo: Optimization of a 200 kW SOFC cogeneration power plant. Part II: variation of the flowsheet

Sentencas: This has the advantage that the external steam generator is eliminated and that the steam concentration in the exhaust gas is reduced.
Titulo: Optimization of a 200 kW SOFC cogeneration power plant. Part II: variation of the flowsheet

Sentencas: Therefore, a higher amount of excess heat can be used.
Titulo: Optimization of a 200 kW SOFC cogeneration power plant. Part II: variation of the flowsheet

Sentencas: Removal of useful heat at higher temperature levels diminishes the driving temperature differences and enlarges the heat exchange area of the recuperative heat exchangers located downstream.
Titulo: Optimization of a 200 kW SOFC cogeneration power plant. Part II: variation of the flowsheet
